attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
Fireworks cause significant and lasting harm to both humans and animals

Every year, thousands of people suffer injuries as a direct result of fireworks. Emergency departments and fire services are stretched unnecessarily

Animals, both domestic & wild, experience severe distress leading to some abandoning young, their habitats & shock so severe it causes death.  

People living with PTSD, autism, anxiety, etc often endure heightened stress & trauma due to the unpredictable & prolonged noise.
attributes.background:
Totally ban the sale of fireworks to the general public. 
Ensure all organised events use reduced noise or silent fireworks in their displays.

rejection.details:
There’s already a petition about this issue. We cannot accept a new petition when we already have one about a very similar issue.  

You are more likely to get action on this issue if you sign and share a single petition. 

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the a similar action:  
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/732559

You may also wish to sign this one:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/739674
